summary: 05/18/2018: An assailant opened fire at Santa Fe High School in Santa Fe, Texas, United States. At least 10 people, including students and teachers, were killed and 14 people, including the assailant, were injured in the attack. Additionally, fake explosive devices were discovered in and around the school. An unaffiliated individual, identified as Dimitrios Pagourtzis, claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that Pagourtzis was interested in Nazism and fascism and had recently posted pictures of German nationalist symbols and a picture of him wearing a T-shirt stating "born to kill" on social media.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that Dimitrios Pagourtzis was interested in Nazism and fascism and had recently posted pictures of German nationalist symbols and a picture of him wearing a T-shirt stating "born to kill" on social media.
weapdetail: A .38-caliber revolver, a shotgun, and two inoperable explosive devices, including several carbon dioxide canisters wrapped in duct tape without a detonator and a pressure cooker with an alarm clock and nails but without explosives, were used in the attack.
addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. While the assailant expressed interest in Nazism and fascism, it is unclear that these were his primary motivations for carrying out the attack.The victims included the school resource officer, John Barnes, and students Angelique Ramirez, Jared Black, Cynthia Tisdale, Rome Shubert, Clayton Horn, and Trenton Beazley. Casualty numbers conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the majority reliable estimates are reported here.

summary: 10/22/2018: A letter bomb was discovered and defused in the mailbox of George Soros, a billionaire and philanthropist, in Katonah, New York, United States. This was one of 16 coordinated mail bomb attacks between October 22, 2018 and November 1, 2018 that targeted critics of President Donald Trump. Cesar Altieri Sayoc was arrested in connection with the incidents. Sources noted that Sayoc's vehicle was covered in right-wing paraphernalia.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that "Right wing paraphernalia" was found covering Cesar Altieri Sayoc's van and he was identified as a vocal Trump supporter.
weapdetail: A six-inch PVC pipe filled with pyrotechnic powder, fertilizer, pool chemicals, and broken glass as shrapnel was used in the attack. The device was connected to a small battery and an inoperative digital clock and mailed in a manila envelope.
scite1: "Suspected explosive device found at George Soros's New York home," Al Jazeera, October 23, 2018.
scite2: "FBI investigating bomb found near home of George Soros in New York State," Politico.eu, October 23, 2018.
scite3: "Cesar Sayoc: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know," Heavy.com, October 26, 2018.

summary: 10/27/2018: An assailant opened fire on a baby-naming ceremony at the Tree of Life Synagogue in Squirrel Hill, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States. At least eleven people were killed and seven other people, including the assailant and four police officers, were injured in the assault and ensuing 20-minute siege with police. Robert D. Bowers claimed responsibility before the attack on social media platform Gab, stating "I can't sit by and watch my people get slaughtered. Screw your optics, I'm going in." Sources also noted that Bowers shouted "all Jews must die" during the incident and that he had a history of anti-Semitic rhetoric on social media.
motive: An unaffiliated individual, identified as Robert D. Bowers, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated on social media that "Hebrew Immigrant Aid Society (HIAS) likes to bring invaders in that kill our people" and "I can’t sit by and watch my people get slaughtered. Screw your optics, I’m going in." Sources also noted that Bowers yelled "All Jews must die!" during the attack.
weapdetail: A Colt AR-15 semi-automatic rifle and three Glock .357-caliber semi-automatic handguns were used in the attack.
addnotes: The victims included Joyce Feinberg, Richard Gottfried, Rose Mallinger, Jerry Rabinowitz, Cecil Rosenthal, David Rosenthal, Bernice Simon, Sylvan Simon, Daniel Stein, Melvin Wax, and Irving Younger.
scite1: "10 people killed in Pittsburgh synagogue shooting, official says," CNN, October 27, 2018.
scite2: "11 killed, six injured in ‘horrific’ shooting at Pittsburgh synagogue," New York Post, October 27, 2018.
scite3: "Pittsburgh Synagogue Shooting Victims Identified," WKMS 91.3 FM, October 28, 2018.

summary: 01/00/2019: Sometime between January 1, 2019 and January 31, 2019, an assailant forced his girlfriend at gunpoint to wear a Schutzstaffel (SS) hat inside his residence in Green Township, New Jersey, United States. Zaremski claimed responsibility for the incident. motive: Michael V. Zaremski, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and forced his ex-girlfriend to wear a Schutzstaffel (SS) hat and then proceeded to take a photo of her and create a fake Instagram account for her in which he followed her Jewish employer. During the incident he also told her that "a woman’s place is to do what the man says." Sources also noted that Zaremski processed "a large collection of white supremacy and Nazi materials" and his ex-girlfriend stated that he had an "obsession with Adolf Hitler."

summary: 03/13/2019: An assailant drove his vehicle into the vehicle of Francesco “Franky Boy” Cali outside his residence in Todt Hill, Staten Island, New York City, United States. When Cali, a Gambino crime boss, came outside, the assailant shot and killed him. Anthony Comello claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources suspected that Comello was influenced by the far-right conspiracy theory known as the "QAnon theory," which indicates "that there is a deep-state plot against Donald Trump." Moreover, according to Comello's attorney, Comello believed "he was helping President Donald Trump defend democracy" and that Cali was part of the "deep state." Sources also noted that Comello wrote "MAGA Forever," "Q," "United We Stand," and "Patriots in Charge" on his hand while in court.

summary: 04/27/2019: An assailant entered Chabad of Poway Synagogue and opened fire on worshipers in Poway, California, United States. At least one person was killed and three people, including the rabbi of the synagogue, were injured in the assault. John T. Earnest was arrested in connection with the attack and posted a manifesto on 8chan and Facebook prior to the incident in which he stated that he believed "every Jew is responsible for the meticulously planned genocide of the European race." Earnest further espoused white supremacist ideology and stated "I hate anyone who seeks the destruction of my race."
motive: John T. Earnest, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated in his manifesto that he believed "Every Jew is responsible for the meticulously planned genocide of the European race." Moreover, in his manifesto, he further espoused white supremacist ideology and stated "I hate anyone who seeks the destruction of my race." Earnest was also responsible for the Dar-ul-Arqam Mosque arson attack on March 24, 2019 in Escondido, California.
weapdetail: A Smith & Wesson M&P15 Sport II semi-automatic rifle was used in the attack.
addnotes: The victims included civilians Lori Gilbert-Kaye, Almog Peretz, and Noya Dahan, and Rabbi Yisroel Goldstein.
scite1: "Man Accused in Poway Synagogue Shooting Charged With Murder, Hate Crimes," City News Service, April 29, 2019.

summary: 08/03/2019: An assailant, armed with a WASR-10 rifle, opened fire on civilians inside a Walmart in El Paso, Texas, United States. At least 23 people were killed and 24 other people were injured in the assault. The victims included United States, Mexican, and German nationals. Authorities arrested the assailant, identified as Patrick Crusius, who claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he was targeting Mexicans. Crusius also published a manifesto prior to the attack where he decried a "Hispanic invasion of Texas" and cited the Christchurch, New Zealand shooter as an inspiration.
motive: Patrick Crusius, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and in his manifesto stated that he targeted members of the Latinx community citing economic reasons and further stating "My whole life I have been preparing for a future that currently doesn’t exist. The job of my dreams will likely be automated. Hispanics will take control of the local and state government of my beloved Texas, changing policy to better suit their needs." Moreover, he wrote "I am against race mixing because it destroys genetic diversity and creates identity problems. Also because it’s completely unnecessary and selfish." He also cited the manifesto of Brenton Tarrant, the perpetrator of the Christchurch, New Zealand attack as inspiration.
weapdetail: A WASR-10 semi-automatic rifle was used in the attack.
addnotes: The victims included Mexican civilians Sara Esther Regalado, Adolfo Cerros Hernandez, Jorge Calvillo Garcia, Elsa Mendoza de la Mora, Gloria Irma Márquez María Eugenia Legarreta Rothe, and Guillermo Garcia. Casualty numbers conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the most recent reliable estimates are reported here.
scite1: "Investigators 'reasonably confident' Texas suspect left anti-immigrant screed, tipped off before attack," NBCNews.com, August 4, 2019.
scite2: "El Paso shooting suspect Patrick Crusius could face the death penalty; hate crime charges possible," Yahoo! Green, August 4, 2019.
scite3: "Death toll in El Paso shooting climbs to 22," AlterNet.org, August 5, 2019.

summary: 08/04/2019: An assailant, armed with an assault-style firearm, opened fire on civilians outside the Ned Peppers bar along East 5th street in Dayton, Ohio, United States. At least 10 people, including the assailant, were killed and 27 other people were injured in the attack. The assailant's sister was among the victims. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities identified the assailant as Connor Stephen Betts. Sources noted that although Betts identified himself as a leftist and had "an obsession with violence and mass shootings," he did not have a racial or political motive for carrying out the attack.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that Connor Stephen Betts had posted "extreme left-wing and anti-police posts, as well as tweets supporting Antifa, or anti-fascist, protesters" on Twitter. Sources also noted that Betts "had an obsession with violence and mass shootings."
weapdetail: An AM-15 .223-caliber semi-automatic firearm with a shortened barrel, a pistol brace, and equipped with a drum magazine was used in the attack.
addnotes: There are doubts that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. The motive for carrying out the attack was unclear and sources noted that Betts was obssessed with mass shootings.
scite1: "Dayton police release dramatic images, details of 32-second mass shooting," New York Daily News, August 13, 2019.
scite2: "Nine People Killed in Mass Shooting In Dayton, Ohio," CBS News, August 4, 2019.

summary: 11/29/2019: An assailant, wearing a fake explosives-laden vest, stabbed participants at a Learning Together conference organized by the University of Cambridge at Fishmongers' Hall on the London bridge in London, England, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Jihadi-inspired extremist. The Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) made an unsubstantied claim for the attack.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that Usman Khan was previously arrested as a member of an Al-Qaida-inspired group that plotted to carry out a bomb attack at the London Stock Exchange.

summary: 12/10/2019: Two assailants opened fire on JC Kosher Supermarket in Jersey City, New Jersey, United States. In addition to the assailants, three people were killed and three others were injured in the attack. David Anderson and Francine Graham, Anti-Semitic extremists, claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote in a note later discovered in the their vehicle, "I do this because my creator makes me do this and I hate who he hates." Sources noted that Anderson and Graham had both anti-Semitic and anti-police motivations and that Anderson had previously been linked to the Black Hebrew Israelite movement. Anderson and Graham were also responsible for the death of Detective Joseph Seals earlier that day along with the murder of Michael Rumberger, a taxi driver, in Bayonne, New Jersey the previous weekend.
motive: David Anderson and Francine Graham claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote in a note later discovered in the their vehicle, "I do this because my creator makes me do this and I hate who he hates." summary: 12/28/2019: An assailant, armed with a machete, attacked the residence of a rabbi, Chaim Rottenberg, while he and his guests were celebrating the seventh night of Hanukkah in Viola, New York, United States. Five people were injured in the attack, and one victim died of his injuries on March 29, 2020. Grafton E. summary: 04/02/2020: An incendiary device was discovered and removed at Ruth's House (a Jewish nursing home) in Longmeadow, Massachusetts, United States. The assailant attempted to light the device by setting fire to a Christian religious pamphlet left in the nozzle of the canister, but the attempt failed. John Michael Rathbun was identified as the assailant through DNA evidence. Sources noted that Rathbun, who had a history of anti-Semitic and racist posts on the internet, including an April 2 online calendar event titled "N…..r killing day" and an April 3 event titled "Jew killing day." Authorities suspected that Rathbun was part of an unnamed white supremacist group that discussed using explosives to carry out mass casualty attacks against religious and racial minorities. An unidentified member of the group posted online in March 2020 that the group should target "that jew nursing home in Longmeadow Massachusetts" which authorities suspect was in reference to Ruth's House.

summary: 05/28/2020: An assailant armed with an AK-47 style rifle opened fire targeting the 3rd precinct police station in Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States. Ivan Harrison Hunter, member of the Boogaloo movement, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "I helped the community burn down that police station” and “I didn’t’ [sic] protest peacefully Dude … Want something to change? Start risking felonies for what is good." Sources noted that Hunter was in contact with Steven Carillo, another member of the Boogaloo movement, and encouraged him to "go for police buildings."

summary: 05/29/2020: Assailants opened fire on federal security officers outside of the Ronald V. Dellums Federal Building in Oakland, California, United States. Officer David Patrick Underwood was killed and another officer was injured in the attack. Authorities arrested Steven Carrillo and Robert Justus in connection with the incident, and Justus confessed his involvement as a driver. Authorities stated that Carrillo and Justus were members of the Boogaloo movement. Steven Carrillo pleaded guilty to murder charges in connection with the attack and stated that he was aligned with the Boogaloo movement and wanted to carry out attacks against federal law enforcement personnel. Sources noted that the assailants were members of a Facebook group affiliated with the Boogaloo movement.
motive: Steven Carrillo pleaded guilty to murder charges in connection with the attack and stated that he was aligned with the Boogaloo movement and wanted to carry out attacks against federal law enforcement personnel. Sources noted that the assailants were members of a Facebook group affiliated with the Boogaloo movement.
weapdetail: A homemade AR-15-style assault rifle using 9-mm ammunition and equipped with a silencer was used in the attack.
addnotes: The victims include officer Dave Patrick Underwood.

summary: 05/29/2020: An assailant armed with a kitchen knife attempted to stab a police officer outside the City Hall building in Temple Terrace, Florida, United States. The assailant was shot and killed while one officer was injured in the attack. The assailant was identified as Heba Momtaz Alazhari. Her brother, Muhammed Momtaz Al-Azhari, had been arrested five days earlier. In a reconstructed note found at her residence, she stated that she wanted to carry out a jihad in revenge for the arrest of her brother.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, authorities reconstructed a torn-up note discovered the residence of Heba Momtaz Alazhari, an unaffiliated individual, stating "I want to do jihad and I must but all I see I [missing piece] do is take the kitchen [missing piece] and [missing piece]ttack the police." Authorities suspected that the attack was carried out in revenge for the arrest of her brother, Muhammed Momtaz Al-Azhari, who was detained five days prior to the attack for plotting an attack inspired by the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
weapdetail: An eight-inch kitchen knife was used in the attack.
scite1: "Police: Woman killed after charging officer with knife," Associated Press Newswires, May 29, 2020.
scite2: "Woman killed in City Hall incident; Police officials say she charged with a knife at Temple Terrace officer.," Tampa Bay Times, May 30, 2020.

summary: 05/29/2020: An assailant lit a container filled with gasoline outside a police station in Washington, District of Columbia, United States. The police station was not damaged in the attack. The assailant, identified as Jerrit Jeremy Pace, was arrested at the scene; in a social media post prior to the attack, Pace "announced his intent to burn down a police station" and "encouraged rioting against law enforcement."
motive: Jerrit Jeremy Pace, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident on social media prior to the attack and stated his intention to burn down a police station, and encouraged others to "riot with the rest of the nation." Sources noted that the attack occurred days after the death of George Floyd, which resulted in widespread protests against police brutality across the United States.
weapdetail: A plastic laundry detergent container filled with gasoline was used in the attack.
scite1: "DC man indicted, charged with attempting to burn down police station," WTOP, July 8, 2020.

Additionally, sources stated that Tran had driven by the protest multiple times and engaged with protesters prior to the assault.
motive: Michael Tran confessed to carrying out the attack and told police that he wanted to drive to the protest and yell "freedom" at the protestors.

summary: 06/03/2020: An assailant stabbed a police officer along Flatbush Avenue in Brooklyn, New York City, United States. After stabbing the officer, the assailant was able to steal his service weapon and shoot and injure two additional officers before the assailant was shot and injured by other officers responding to the scene. Dzenan Camovic, who allegedly shouted "Allahu Akbar" before carrying out the attack, was indicted in connection with the incident. Authorities stated that he possessed materials regarding violent extremism and specifically materials related to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
motive: Dzenan Camovic, an unaffiliated individual, shouted "Allahu Akhbar" during the attack and later confessed to hospital workers, stating "religion made me do it." Authorities found lectures from Anwar Al-Awlaki and Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) propaganda at Camovic's residence. A year prior to the attack, Camovic expressed interest in Syria-based extremist groups and the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL), and spoke about killing civilians according to an unnamed witness.
weapdetail: A firearm and a knife were used in the attack.
scite1: "NYPD releases footage of cop being stabbed during unprovoked Brooklyn attack," New York Post, June 7, 2020.
scite2: "Cops wounded in Brooklyn attack leave hospital to cheers from fellow officers," New York Post, June 5, 2020.
scite3: "FBI Investigates After  Shooting, Stabbing of NYPD Cops in Flatbush," Jewish Press, June 4, 2020.

summary: 06/05/2020: An assailant drove his vehicle through the front doors of a Target located at 2030 Hammond Square Drive in Hammond, Louisiana, United States. The assailant then exited the vehicle, walked/ran through the store, and exited out of the back. He attempted to carjack various vehicles before he was arrested by police officers. During the incident the assailant also dropped four suspicious packages that he wanted people to believe were explosive devices. None of the packages contained explosive material. At least one person was injured by shards of glass when the assailant initially drove into the store. The assailant was identified as Walter Allbritton III. Allbritton posted multiple videos on Facebook Live during the attack and made various comments about the police and wondering whether he would be shot.
motive: Walter Allbritton III claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "I just want my money" and "you're going to have to kill me" on Facebook live just before the attack.
weaptype1_txt: Vehicle (not to include vehicle-borne explosives, i.e., car or truck bombs)
weapdetail: An SUV and fake explosive devices were used in the attack.
addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. There was no known motive for the attack - though the assailant used political messaging in a video of the incident - and given the usage of fake explosives, it was difficult to deduce intentions without further information.
scite1: "Police identify suspect in Hammond Target bomb threat, witness says he wore white cape," The Advocate, June 5, 2020.

summary: 06/20/2020: An assailant armed with a knife stabbed civilians at Forbury Gardens park in Reading, England, United Kingdom. At least three civilians, including a US citizen, were killed and three civilians were injured in the attack. Authorities arrested Khairi Saadallah, a Libyan national who had been granted asylum, and Saadallah admitted to carrying out the attack.
motive: Khairi Saadallah, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and shouted "Allahu Akbar" and "God accept my jihad" during the attack. He later told police "Those men I killed were wrong 'uns, they deserved it. I'm going to paradise for the jihad what I did to them." Authorities discovered an image of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) flag and the Twin Towers, and links to videos about "Jihadi John" on his phone cache. Intelligence services believed that Saadallah had planned to travel to Syria, and it was later revealed in court proceedings that he received training from Ansar al-Sharia (Libya) during his time in Libya.

summary: 07/03/2020: An assailant intentionally rammed his truck into a motorcycle driver in Taycheedah, Wisconsin, United States. Navarro stated that he targeted a motorcycle because he wanted to kill the person and targeted a Harley-Davidson because of their racist culture. He also stated that he carried out the attack because of the world being created by President Donald Trump and white people. Furthermore, he asserted that he had thoughts of causing a vehicle accident earlier in the day before he eventually carried out the attack.
motive: Daniel Navarro, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility and stated that the incident was in retaliation for "the world we are living in," created by "Donald Trump and white people." Navarro intentionally targeted a Harley-Davidson motorcycle because "only white people drive Harleys," and that he believes people who drive Harley-Davidson motorcycles are typically "white racists."

summary: 07/04/2020: Assailants assaulted Vauhxx Booker at Lake Monroe in Bloomington, Indiana, United States. Booker, an African-American activist, was on his way to a Lunar Eclipse viewing party at the lake when he had a confrontation with the assailants, who were claiming that the victims were trespassing on private property. During the confrontation, several men grabbed Booker and pinned him against a tree and began assaulting him and threatening to break his arm. One assailant even asked another person to grab a noose. Booker was eventually freed from the assailants by his companions. In the video the assailants can be seen attacking the victim and can be heard screaming several racial slurs and denigrating the victims. Sean Purdy and Jerry Cox were arrested and charged in connection with the attack.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that the assailants shouted "white power" and racial slurs during the attack, and threatened to "get a noose."
addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. Sources noted the assailants were intoxicated at the time of the attack, and it was unclear whether the attack was spontaneous.
scite1: "2 men charged in assault on Black man at Indiana lake," Associated Press Newswires, July 17, 2020.
scite2: "FBI investigating alleged racist attack in Indiana, lawyer says," CNN Wire, July 8, 2020.
scite3: "'They didn't even see me as human': Black activist recounts how a group of white men attacked him and allegedly threatened to 'get a noose' at a lake in Indiana as FBI launches investigation," Mail Online, July 8, 2020.

summary: 11/05/2020: Authorities arrested two armed individuals who drove from Virginia and parked their vehicle near the Convention Center in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States. There were no casualties in the incident. Conspiracy-theory extremists claimed responsibility for the incident. They claimed they intended to "straighten things out" in the Convention Center, where votes were being counted for the United States Presidential Election which took place on November 3, 2020. Sources noted that the assailants' possessed ammunition and a lock-picking tool in their vehicle, which was adorned with a QAnon sticker.
motive: The assailants, Joshua Macias and Antonio LaMotta, were driving a truck with a sticker referencing the QAnon conspiracy theory. Authorities uncovered text messages between the assailants referencing a plan to raid "a truckload of fake ballots" and believed that the assailants intended "straighten things out" in the Philadelphia Convention Center, where votes were being counted for the United States Presidential Election which took place on November 3, 2020. Source also noted that LaMotta had a history of social media posts containing anti-Semitic cartoons and QAnon conspiracy theories.
weapdetail: A homemade AR-15-style assault rifle, a .40-caliber Beretta pistol, and a 9-mm Beretta pistol were used in the attack.

summary: 12/13/2020: An assailant set fire to the back door of the Martin Luther King, Jr. Community Presbyterian Church in Springfield, Massachusetts, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Dushko Vulchev, an unaffiliated individual, was arrested and later indicted for this and two other attacks on the same predominately Black church in December 2020. Authorities stated that Vulchev had a history of expressing racial hatred towards Black people, including a message on his device stating "eliminate all N****s." His electronic devices also contained images of a "White Lives Matter" mural and an Adolf Hitler photo.
